Question
========

From each of two normally distributed populations with equal variances a sample is drawn.______________. Sample 1: n = 14, mean = 22, sd = 8.24. Sample 2: n = 17, mean = 25, sd = 6.11. The pooled variance estimator takes the value 51.03. It is tested Whether the population averages are equal. The corresponding test size follows, if the null hypothesis is TRUE,

Answerlist
----------

* An F-distribution with 14 and 17 degrees of freedom
* A T distribution with 29 degrees of freedom
* An F-division with 13 and 16 degrees of freedom
* A T distribution with 31 degrees of freedom

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* An F-distribution with 14 and 17 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* A T-division with 29 degrees of freedom: Correct
* An F-division with 13 and 16 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* A T-division with 31 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
